welcome.title: Part-time Training Calculator
welcome.intro: Welcome to the Part-time Training Calculator. Choose the design that best suits you.
welcome.question: Do you want to use the compact design or the guided design? For most users we recommend the guided design.
welcome.legalDisclaimer: Note: This calculator is for informational purposes only and is not legally binding. The actual training duration is determined by the responsible chamber (IHK/HWK) and the training company.
welcome.faqIntro: Short answers about the part-time training calculator. Includes easy-to-read wording.

calcHow.question: How is the part-time duration calculated?
calcHow.answer: We divide your desired weekly hours by the full-time hours to get the part-time factor. We apply this factor to the base duration after all reductions and then check protection limits (at least the chamber minimum, at most 1.5 √ó the standard duration).
calcHow.easy: In short: Your hours divided by full-time, then we use that to compute the new duration.

rule50.question: What does the 50% rule mean?
rule50.answer: Part-time must be at least 50% of full-time hours. If you are below that, we cannot calculate and show an error.
rule50.easy: In short: Below half of full-time we cannot calculate part-time.

below50.question: Can I work below 50%?
below50.answer: The calculator does not support that because it is outside the usual rule. Please talk to your chamber and company if you plan less than 50%.
below50.easy: In short: Under 50% only works if chamber and company agree. The calculator cannot handle it.

invalid.question: What happens if my inputs are invalid?
invalid.answer: We stop the calculation and show a clear message, for example when values are outside the allowed range or missing.
invalid.easy: In short: Wrong inputs are rejected and you see a hint about what is missing.

adjustHours.question: How do I change the full-time hours if my company uses different numbers?
adjustHours.answer: Enter the actual full-time hours of your company in the ‚ÄúFull-time hours per week‚Äù field. All dependent values update automatically.
adjustHours.easy: In short: Enter the real full-time hours at the top; the rest adjusts automatically.

capReduction.question: Why is my reduction capped?
capReduction.answer: We apply maximum reductions (for example 6 months) and a protection limit: part-time lasts at most 1.5 √ó the standard duration. This keeps results realistic and chamber-compliant.
capReduction.easy: In short: There are caps for reduction and extension so the result stays realistic.

binding.question: Is the result binding?
binding.answer: No. The result is guidance. The final decision is made by your responsible chamber together with the training company.
binding.easy: In short: It‚Äôs guidance only. Chamber and company decide.

whoDecides.question: Who decides about reduction and duration?
whoDecides.answer: The responsible chamber (IHK/HWK) and your training company decide together. The calculator gives a transparent basis for the conversation.
whoDecides.easy: In short: Chamber and company decide together. The calculator only shows a direction.

transparency.title: How is this calculated?
transparency.intro: Here is the full calculation in plain language.
transparency.ratio: Your {{part}} hours per week are {{pct}} % of {{full}} hours.

step1.title: Step 1: Check minimum hours
step1.ok: Share is above 50%. This is allowed.
step1.fail: Share is below 50%. This is too low for part-time training.

step2.title: Step 2: Part-time factor
step2.text: We calculate: {{part}} hours divided by {{full}} hours. Result is factor {{factor}}.

step3.title: Step 3: Base duration
step3.text: Start: {{fullM}} months. We subtract reductions ({{reductions}}). Left: {{rawBase}} months. Due to minimum duration we use {{basis}} months ({{basisYM}}).

step4.title: Step 4: New part-time duration
step4.text: Base {{basis}} months divided by factor {{factor}} results in {{dtheo}} months.

step5.title: Step 5: Protective rules
step5.sixApplied: Extension would be {{extension}} months. We limit it to {{limited}} months (6-month rule).
step5.sixSkipped: Extension is {{extension}} months. This is okay (under 6 months).
step5.capApplied: Result would be {{afterSix}} months. Too long (Max: {{cap}} months). We cap at {{cap}} months.

simple.title: How this is calculated
simple.teaser: Your {{desiredHours}} hours per week are {{percentage}} of the normal {{fullTimeHours}} hours.

step1.title: Step 1: Check minimum hours
step1.text: We check if your hours are allowed as part-time. If not, we stop the calculation.

step2.title: Step 2: Share of full-time
step2.text: We compare your hours to full time. This shows how much you work weekly (e.g. 75%).

step3.title: Step 3: Determine base duration
step3.text: We start with the normal training time and subtract possible reductions (max 12 months). Then we use at least the statutory minimum.

step4.title: Step 4: Calculate part-time duration
step4.text: Using your hours share we estimate how long the training will take (theoretical value).

step5.title: Step 5: Apply protection rules
step5.text: Small extensions up to 6 months are ignored. Duration must not exceed 1.5√ó the normal time.

step6.title: Step 6: Round and show result
step6.text: We round down to full months and show the final result.

bbig7a.heading: ¬ß7a BBiG ‚Äì Part-time vocational training
bbig7a.text1: The company and the apprentices can agree to run the training in part-time. The regular weekly training hours are permanently reduced so that training and other commitments fit together.
bbig7a.text2: Even with fewer weekly hours, the goal stays the same: all training content must be covered. This can extend the overall duration or the company adapts the plan to make up the missing time.

hwo27b.heading: ¬ß27b HwO ‚Äì Part-time training in crafts
hwo27b.text1: In crafts, training can also be arranged as part-time. The company and apprentices decide together how many hours per week are reduced so that family, care, or other reasons are considered.
hwo27b.text2: It remains crucial that all professional content is covered. The company plans the practical phases so that, despite fewer hours, full qualification is achieved.

easy.heading: In simple language
easy.point1: Part-time training means fewer hours per week than usual.
easy.point2: The total duration can become longer because you learn fewer hours each week.
easy.point3: The company and apprentices decide together how much to reduce.
easy.point4: The chamber checks and approves so everything is official.
easy.point5: All important learning content stays the same.

notice.heading: Important notice
notice.text: This information does not replace legal advice. The responsible chamber always decides on reductions and process.
